org.ingatan.component.librarymanager
Class QuestionList

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.ingatan.component.librarymanager.QuestionList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class QuestionList
extends javax.swing.JPanel

The question list is a JScrollPane based container which holds all of the QuestionContainers for questions that exist in a library. It has a few methods relevant to the state of the questions within the list, such as select/deselect all, minimise/maximise all, etc. NOTE: SHOULD HAVE USED ARRAY LIST OF CONTAINERS HERE, NOT ARRAY - will be re-implemented

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

Gets the question data from the container that is an ancestor of the currently focussed component.

Parameters:

Returns:

searchFor

public void searchFor(java.lang.String searchFor)
Searches all questions contained by this question container for the specified terms. The terms are split by whitespace.

Parameters:
searchFor - search terms, each separated by whitespace

rebuildList

public void rebuildList()
Rebuilds the question list from the questionContainers array. Note: be sure that the questions have been updated using the updateQuestionsWithContent method first!

groupContainers

public void groupContainers(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractQuestionContainer> containers)
Groups separated questions up so that the first entry in the containers parameter is the first member of the group. Assumes that the first element of the containers parameter is the container most near the top of the list. If will be the case if the containers parameter has been generated by the 'getSelectedContainers' method. If not, and the first element is not the highest in the list, then odd index behaviour may result.

Parameters:
containers - the containers to group.

addActionListener

public void addActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
Adds an ActionListener to this QuestionList instance. The action listeners are notified when the current question changes focus. The question that has focus after the change is accessible by using the event ID passed in the ActionEvent and using this as the index for questionList.getQuestions().

Example:
questionList.getQuestions[actionEvent.getID()];

Parameters:
listener - the ActionListener to add.

removeActionListener

public boolean removeActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
Removes a ActionListener from this QuestionList instance.

Parameters:
listener - the ActionListener to remove.
Returns:
true if the listener could be found and removed, and false otherwise.

removeAll

public void removeAll()
Remove all questions from the list and the questionContainers Array.

Overrides:
removeAll in class java.awt.Container

getSelectedContainers

public java.util.ArrayList<AbstractQuestionContainer> getSelectedContainers()
Gets an array of selected question containers.

Returns:
an array containing all of the currently selected question containers. Returns an empty AbstractQuestionContainer array if no containers are selected.

containersAreContiguous

public boolean containersAreContiguous(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractQuestionContainer> containers)
Tests whether the array of containers passed are grouped or not. Assumes that the first member of containers are in order as they would appear moving down the question list.

Returns:
true if the containers specified are grouped, or if the parameter array contains less than 2 elements. Returns false if the containers are not contiguous, or if the first container does not exist in the array.

getSelectionIndex

public int getSelectionIndex()
Gets the index of the selection. If multiple items are selected, this is the index of the first selected item (highest in the list). If no selection exists, then this method will return -1.

Returns:
the index of the first selected item found in the list, or -1 if no selected items are found.

copyQuestions

public void copyQuestions(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractQuestionContainer> containers)
Copies the specified questions to the clipboard as text - copies them as elements as returned by WriterParser. The copied text contains a header which indicates which library the questions belong to so that the paste destination knows where to access the resources (images, etc.)

cutQuestions

public void cutQuestions(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractQuestionContainer> containers)
Calls copyQuestions and then removes the selected questions from the list.

pasteQuestions

public void pasteQuestions(java.lang.String destinationLibraryID)
                    throws DataConversionException,
                           java.io.IOException,
                           java.awt.datatransfer.UnsupportedFlavorException
If the clipboard contains questions then this method will insert them at the bottom of the current question list. Image references should be resolved automatically.

Throws:
DataConversionException
java.io.IOException
java.awt.datatransfer.UnsupportedFlavorException

addQuestion

public void addQuestion(IQuestion question)
Add a question in the appropriate question container to the question list. Also adds the question to the questionContainers array.

Parameters:
question - the question to add.

addQuestion

public void addQuestion(IQuestion question,
                        boolean selected)
Add a question in the appropriate question container to the question list. Also adds the question to the questionContainers array.

Parameters:
question - the question to add.
selected - whether or not the container should be selected

addQuestion

public void addQuestion(IQuestion question,
                        boolean selected,
                        int index)
Add a question in the appropriate question container to the question list. Also adds the question to the questionContainers array.

Parameters:
question - the question to add.
selected - whether or not the container should be selected
index - the index at which the question should be added, -1 if you want it added to the end.

removeQuestion

public void removeQuestion(AbstractQuestionContainer qContainer)
Remove the specified question container from the question list. If the question container does not exist in the list, no action is taken.

Parameters:
qContainer - the question to be removed.

moveQuestionsDown

public void moveQuestionsDown(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractQuestionContainer> containers)
Move the specified containers down by one index (if possible). The containers will be grouped if not already. The first container in the array must be the highest in the question list (i.e. the one with the smallest index).

Parameters:
containers - the containers to move.

moveQuestionsUp

public void moveQuestionsUp(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractQuestionContainer> containers)
Move the specified containers up by one index (if possible). The containers will be grouped if not already. The first container in the array must be the highest in the question list (i.e. the one with the smallest index).

Parameters:
containers - the containers to move.

updateQuestionsWithContent

public void updateQuestionsWithContent()
Updates the internal question classes with the data in the question containers.

getQuestions

public IQuestion[] getQuestions()
Get the questions listed in this QuestionList instance.

Returns:
the questions listed in this QuestionList instance.
